abstract: The processing algorithm used to manage audio pitch at different rates.
overview:
## Discussion

The default value on iOS is [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVAudioTimePitchAlgorithm/lowQualityZeroLatency]; on macOS, the default is [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVAudioTimePitchAlgorithm/timeDomain]. The device automatically mutes audio when [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVQueuedSampleBufferRendering/timebase] is not supported by [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVAudioTimePitchAlgorithm]. Modifying this property while [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVQueuedSampleBufferRendering/timebase] is not `0.0` may cause the rate to briefly change to `0.0`.

# audioTimePitchAlgorithm

**Instance Property**

The processing algorithm used to manage audio pitch at different rates.

## Declaration

```swift
var audioTimePitchAlgorithm: AVAudioTimePitchAlgorithm { get set }
```

## Discussion

The default value on iOS is [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVAudioTimePitchAlgorithm/lowQualityZeroLatency]; on macOS, the default is [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVAudioTimePitchAlgorithm/timeDomain]. The device automatically mutes audio when [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVQueuedSampleBufferRendering/timebase] is not supported by [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVAudioTimePitchAlgorithm]. Modifying this property while [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVQueuedSampleBufferRendering/timebase] is not `0.0` may cause the rate to briefly change to `0.0`.

## Configuring time and pitch

- **AVAudioTimePitchAlgorithm**: An algorithm used to set the audio pitch as the rate changes.
